info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 2:32PM MST until September 12 at 4:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 232 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The rain gauge at Hualapai Foothills has received 2.36 inches of rain since 130 PM MST. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. The neighborhood between Highway 147 and Interstate 40 has seen the heaviest rain including Louise Avenue and Southern Avenue. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingman and New Kingman-Butler. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
